results.title: General compliance requirements for insurance advertising
results.description: The NAIC Model (Model 880) specifically applies to any entity “engaged in the business of insurance.” This definition covers all insurance companies, regardless of which products they offer. The NAIC amends Model 880 periodically, most recently in 2024. While the most recent version has not yet been enacted, the prior Model is law in all but five states—Alabama, Illinois, Oregon, Utah, and Wisconsin—that have different UTPA provisions. As noted, the Model UTPA is multi-faceted. With respect to advertising, it sets forth activities that constitute unfair trade practices, for which penalties are possible...

results.title: Compliance requirements for life insurance and annuity products
results.description: The NAIC Model and state regulations require that advertisements be readily understandable by an audience of average education or intelligence. That is, advertisements may not use jargon or legal language that may not be clearly understood by ...

results.title: Compliance requirements for advertising Medicare Supplement Insurance products
results.description: As described in prior blog posts, the NAIC creates and publishes Model regulations on common insurance issues to assist state regulators and encourage more state-by-state uniformity. Regarding MedSupp, the Models are Model Regulation To Implement The NAIC Medicare Supplement Insurance Minimum Standards (MDL 651) and Model Rules Governing Advertisements of Medicare Supplement Insurance With Interpretive Guidelines (MDL 660)

results.title: National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC)
results.description: According to the NAIC's most recent aggregated data from state insurance departments, the majority of complaints in 2021 involved how an insurer handled policyholders' claims, with unsatisfactory settlements or offers, delayed claims, and denied claims collectively accounting for just over 50% of all complaints. Other types of complaints, though much lower on the list in terms of percentages, included high-pressure sales tactics, misleading advertising...

results.title: NAIC Life Insurance Illustrations Model Regulation - Actuarial Standards BoardActuarial Standards Board
results.description: In 2020, the NAIC released Actuarial Guideline XLIX-A (AG 49-A) for illustrations of policies with indexed credits linked to an index or indices sold on or after December 14, 2020. The NAIC also amended AG 49 to sunset its applicability to illustrations of policies sold on or after this date and to allow insurers to elect to apply AG 49-A to new illustrations of policies sold prior to this date that otherwise would be subject to AG 49.

results.description: 2. Marginally Allocated: Marginally allocated expenses are unit expenses calculated in a manner similar to fully allocated unit expenses except that indirect expenses, such as corporate overhead and general advertising, are not allocated to the policy forms. 3. Generally Recognized Expense Table (GRET): GRET unit expenses are obtained from an industry expense study based on fully allocated expenses representing a significant portion of insurance companies and approved for use by the NAIC or by the commissioner.

results.title: Understanding Naic Insurance: Role, Regulation, And Consumer Protection Explained | ShunIns
results.description: Its primary objective is to ensure fair insurance markets by establishing and maintaining standards that promote transparency, competition, and equity. The NAIC achieves this through the development of model laws and regulations that states can adopt to create a uniform regulatory framework. These models help prevent unfair trade practices, such as deceptive advertising ...

results.title: What Is the AAA NAIC Number?
results.description: Although the main AAA NAIC number is 11983, the NAIC has assigned a separate code for each of AAA’s affiliate companies, which are listed below. You can find the number that applies to your particular policy on your AAA insurance card.

results.title: What is NAIC Insurance? Role & Importance in Regulation | Equisoft
results.description: NAIC, short for National Association of Insurance Commissioners, is a nonprofit regulatory organization that establishes standards and guidelines for the U.S. insurance industry. results.title: Comprehensive Guide to the NAIC Model Law | RadarFirst
results.description: As of today, only five states have passed a comprehensive set of Privacy Bills, while 21 have passed data laws specifically relating to the insurance industry. The pace of adoption of the Model Law hastened due to a report issued by the U.S. Treasury Department in October 2017. In the report, the U.S. Treasury urged prompt action by states to adopt the NAIC Model Law within five years.
